column4: can http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/ handle a 350K paste?  (log file)
try it ;)
you talking about the BadRam patch?
that's it, I think
there is BadRam and BadMem - forlks or something.  I could never get them to work with 2.6
I haven't needed to use them, but I read about them
I had a 256 meg laptop stick that had a few bad bits... could never get it to work, freind looked at it and said "forget it"
I had some marginal ram in my old t22, but the errors 'moved around', so I just underclocked it a bit
I opened multi-megabyte html pages in ancient versions of mozilla
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/12579  the last line I see is # 1927 Apr1918:39:57debconf:<--0multiselectbackupprogresscancel
and then lots of 'emptyness'
line numbers run out at 4941 here, but the file continues...
last line I see is "5 logical  378.3 MB   F swap       swap   , , Undo changes to partitions, Finish partitioning and write changes to disk"
the file was made with head -n 4940 syslog >syslog4940  so thats about right
according to w3m it's over a meg
the file was 350k - guess threre is a bit of overhead
did you build a kernel with make-kpkg and install it? that'll do it
perhaps a kernel source package will
k - I was hoping somenone knew which one - installed a bunch
dpkg -S /full/path/to/build will tell you
thanks - linux-headers-2.6.15-22-686
